benchmark_details.name: SIMCODE
benchmark_details.overview: SIMCODE is introduced as the first benchmark to evaluate LLMsâ€™ ability to generate executable ns-3 simulation code from natural language. It includes 400 tasks across introductory, intermediate, and advanced levels, each with a prompt, verified C++ solution, and test cases.
benchmark_details.data_type: triplet of natural language prompt, C++ solution, and test cases

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the ability of LLMs to generate correct and executable ns-3 simulation code from natural language prompts.

data.source: Curated simulation tasks from various sources, including university-level networking coursework and the official ns-3 example repository.
data.annotation: Each solution was verified to run correctly in the ns-3 environment.

methodology.calculation: Execution accuracy measures the proportion of generated code samples that successfully compile and execute. CodeBLEU and CodeBERTScore assess syntactic structure and semantic correctness.
methodology.interpretation: Higher execution accuracy indicates better capability of the LLM in generating correct code.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4.1 achieved up to 30.6% execution accuracy.
methodology.validation: Evaluation of models was conducted across six prompt techniques.
